DataElement.preferredName: Edit Over-ride Behavior International Classification of Diseases Oncology 1 (ICD-O-1) Code
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Area for retaining behavior portion (1 digit) of the ICD-O-1 or field trial morphology codes entered before a conversion to ICD-O-2.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Edit Over-ride Behavior International Classification of Diseases Oncology 1
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Area for retaining behavior portion (1 digit) of the ICD-O-1 or field trial morphology codes entered before a conversion to ICD-O-2.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: The type of change made to an element.:To take precedence over and countermand, thereby allowing an activity to continue despite a warning or error.

Concepts.definition: The type of change made to an element.
To take precedence over and countermand, thereby allowing an activity to continue despite a warning or error.

Property.preferredName: Behavior International Classification of Diseases Oncology One
Property.preferredDefinition: human or animal activity studied in terms of motivation, direction, result, emotion, perception, or etiology.:A system of categories to which morbid entries are assigned according to established criteria. Included is the entire range of conditions in a manageable number of categories, grouped to facilitate mortality reporting. It is produced by the World Health Organization (from ICD-10, p1). The Clinical Modifications, produced by the United States Dept. of Health and Human Services, are larger extensions used for morbidity and general epidemiological purposes, primarily in the U.S. (MSH2005_2004_10_12):The study of tumors encompassing the physical, chemical, and biologic properties.:The smallest natural number and quantity it denotes: a single entity, unit, or object.

Concepts.definition: The actions or reactions of an object or organism, usually in relation to the environment or surrounding world of stimuli.

A system of categories to which morbid entries are assigned according to established criteria. Included is the entire range of conditions in a manageable number of categories, grouped to facilitate mortality reporting. It is produced by the World Health Organization. The Clinical Modifications, produced by the United States Dept. of Health and Human Services, are larger extensions used for morbidity and general epidemiological purposes, primarily in the U.S.
The study of tumors encompassing the physical, chemical, and biologic properties.
The smallest natural number and quantity it denotes: a single entity, unit, or object.

Included is the entire range of conditions in a manageable number of categories, grouped to facilitate mortality reporting. It is produced by the World Health Organization (from ICD-10, p1). The Clinical Modifications, produced by the United States Dept. of Health and Human Services, are larger extensions used for morbidity and general epidemiological purposes, primarily in the U.S. (MSH2005_2004_10_12)_The study of tumors encompassing the physical, chemical, and biologic properties._The smallest natural number and quantity it denotes: a single entity, unit, or object._A system of numbered categories for representation of data. ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Conceptual entities required by NCI operations and systems. Includes administrative, financial, organizational and quasi-scientific concepts required for NCI operations and systems.

Included is the entire range of conditions in a manageable number of categories, grouped to facilitate mortality reporting. It is produced by the World Health Organization. ReferenceDocuments.description: For additional details see NAACCR, Standards for Cancer Registries Volume II, Version 11.1 Data Standards and Data Dictionary (5/4/06)

ReferenceDocuments.name: Behavior (73-91) ICD-O-1 Description
ReferenceDocuments.description: See grouped data item Morph (73-91) ICD-O-1 [1970] in Appendix E. The item name includes years 73-91. However, some states may have used the codes for cases before 1973. It is a subfield of the morphology code.
